org.jets3t.apps.cockpit.gui
Class ProgressDisplay

java.lang.Object
  org.jets3t.apps.cockpit.gui.ProgressDisplay
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ProgressDisplay
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class that displays and controls a dialog that shows progress information to the user for long-lived tasks.

This class wraps the dialog rather than making the dialog directly available in order to maintain more control over when and how the dialog is updated.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

ProgressDisplay

public ProgressDisplay(java.awt.Frame owner,
                       java.lang.String title,
                       java.lang.String statusText,
                       java.lang.String detailsText,
                       int minTaskValue,
                       int maxTaskValue,
                       java.lang.String cancelButtonText,
                       CancelEventTrigger cancelEventListener)
Constructor for creating a progress dialog.

Parameters:
owner - the Frame over which the progress dialog will be displayed and centred
title - the title for the progress dialog
statusText - describes the status of a task text meaningful to the user, such as "3 files of 7 uploaded"
detailsText - describes the status of a task in more detail, such as the current transfer rate and ETA.
minTaskValue - the minimum progress value for a task, generally 0
maxTaskValue - the maximum progress value for a task, such as the total number of threads or 100 if using percentage-complete as a metric.
cancelEventListener - listener that is responsible for cancelling a long-lived task when the user clicks the cancel button. If a task cannot be cancelled this must be null.
cancelButtonText - text displayed in the cancel button if a task can be cancelled. This is only used if a cancel event listener is provided.
Method Detail

startDialog

public void startDialog()
Displays the progress dialog.

updateProgress

public void updateProgress(int progressValue)
Updates the dialog's progress value, which is reflected in a percentage-complete progress bar.

Parameters:
progressValue - value representing how far through the task we are, somewhere between minTaskValue and maxTaskValue as set in the constructor.

updateStatusMessages

public void updateStatusMessages(java.lang.String statusMessage,
                                 java.lang.String detailsText)
Updates the dialog's status messages.

Parameters:
statusMessage - text describing the status of a task text meaningful to the user, such as "3 files of 7 uploaded"
detailsText - detailed description of the task's status, such as the current transfer rate and remaining time.

getCancelClicked

public boolean getCancelClicked()
Returns:
true if the user cancelled the task (with the cancel button), false otherwise.

dispose

public void dispose()
Disposes the wrapped progress dialog.
